intro: Melampodium hirsutum, commonly known as the hairy sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is characterized by its bright yellow-orange flowers and hairy, gray-green foliage. The plant belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, often found in open fields and disturbed areas. Melampodium hirsutum is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
